unnormalised: In a significant ruling, the Delhi High Court on 20/07/2024 addressed a long-pending property dispute case, Civil Suit No. 456/2020, between the Sharma and Verma families. The case revolved around a disputed ancestral property located at 10, Civil Lines, Delhi, 110054, valued at approx. Rs. 2.5 crore.
normalised: In a significant ruling, the Delhi High Court on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four addressed a long-pending property dispute case, Civil Suit Number four hundred and fifty six slash two thousand and twenty, between the Sharma and Verma families. The case revolved around a disputed ancestral property located at ten, Civil Lines, Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and fifty four, valued at approximately rupee two point five crore.

unnormalised: Justice Malhotra, presiding over the bench, ruled in favor of the Sharma family, citing a lack of sufficient evidence presented by the Verma family to substantiate their claim. The court order stated that the original ownership documents, dating back to 1947, clearly indicated the property belonged to Mr. R.K. Sharma, the patriarch of the Sharma family. It's a big win for them, after years of legal battles!
